thread.title: Khalsa's 'blessed' FA Cup run goes on
thread.title_full: Khalsa's 'blessed' FA Cup run goes on

title: Khalsa's 'blessed' FA Cup run goes on
text:
Sporting Khalsa target more trophies 
He said: "This long midweek trip is new and I’ll be waiting by my phone all today to see those that can get a half-day at work. 
“We’ve got two lads whose suspensions begin from a league game. It could be square pegs in round holes, but it’s the FA Cup and it’s 90 minutes.” 
Spalding led when fleet-footed winger Josh Moreman picking up the ball on the flank, cutting in and firing a shot which appeared to take a bounce to elude goalkeeper James Pemberton. 
Bannister had two efforts blocked by the drilled Spalding defence on 32 minutes and three minutes later the same player curled a free-kick over the bar from 20 yards. 
Spalding responded with a deflected Nialle Rodney shot and Adam Jackson blazing an effort well over the bar. What do you think? Be the first to comment 
But Khalsa were the better side after the break, Marvin Nisbett stinging the gloves of goalkeeper Michael Duggan. 
They secured a Tuesday replay with a goal in injury time. Duggan brought down Nisbett and Meese stepped forward to score. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
